question: How do I know if I am eligible for the new income Special Enrollment Period?
text:
How do I know if I am eligible for the new income Special Enrollment Period? 
          
        
Pennie has added a new Qualifying Life Event (QLE) for new customers who have an annual household income equal to or below 150% federal poverty level (FPL), who qualify for financial assistance. If you are not currently enrolled in Pennie coverage, and your income is at, or below, the corresponding amount for your household size, all you need to do is submit your new Pennie application to see if you qualify!






Household / Family Size






Income 150% FPL










Single






$21,870










2-person






$29,580










3-person






$37,290










4-person






$45,000



























To enroll in the Special Enrollment Period under this qualifying life event, follow these steps below:


Go to pennie.com, click 
Get Covered, 
and submit a new Pennie application.


If you qualify, a Special Enrollment Period (SEP) will automatically open!


Once the SEP opens, you will have 60-days to enroll in a plan through Pennie. Once you enroll, coverage will begin the start of the following month.
